content.raw:
got docker to build and compile my repo on the field computer.  However, the script (fc_run_team_docker.bash) that runs the image creates a container that does not have the ports exposed that I specified.
At first, I thought that was just because the script overrides my CMD statement.  However, I put the EXPOSE 8000 and other ports into the main body of my dockerfile and they are still not exposed.  If I run the container myself, with no extra attributes (docker run --rm --name mytest fcomputer), then the ports are exposed properly:


```
#!c++

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
4fb34926ca3a        fcomputer           "/ros_entrypoint.sh /"   33 minutes ago      Up 33 minutes                           team_container
ubuntu@ip-172-31-31-100:~$ docker ps -a
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS                     NAMES
5732ad1348b9        fcomputer                "/ros_entrypoint.sh /"   10 seconds ago      Up 9 seconds        3490-3491/tcp, 8000/tcp   mytest
```
content.html:
got docker to build and compile my repo on the field computer. However, the script (fc_run_team_docker.bash) that runs the image creates a container that does not have the ports exposed that I specified. At first, I thought that was just because the script overrides my CMD statement. However, I put the EXPOSE 8000 and other ports into the main body of my dockerfile and they are still not exposed. If I run the container myself, with no extra attributes (docker run --rm --name mytest fcomputer), then the ports are exposed properly:

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
4fb34926ca3a        fcomputer           "/ros_entrypoint.sh /"   33 minutes ago      Up 33 minutes                           team_container
ubuntu@ip-172-31-31-100:~$ docker ps -a
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS                     NAMES
5732ad1348b9        fcomputer                "/ros_entrypoint.sh /"   10 seconds ago      Up 9 seconds        3490-3491/tcp, 8000/tcp   mytest
